title: Love Island’s Chris Hughes opens up about weight loss after worryingly losing his appetite
text:

Love Island star Chris Hughes has opened up about his dramatic weight loss and lack of appetite.

The reality TV hunk, 26, admitted he currently has to 'force feed' himself and is worried by the unusual change in his diet.

Chris told The Sun Online that he thinks the problem could be down to stress and has been to the doctors for blood tests.

During last night's Pride Of Britain Awards 2019 , Chris spoke honestly about his dilemma with food.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

He told the publication : "I don't know what's up with me.

"I've always had an appetite. I used to have two burgers a day when I was filming with Kem. I could eat and eat and eat."

The star, who rose to fame on the 2018 series of ITV2's popular summer dating show, recalled previously being able to scoff down 'two burgers a day' but now struggles to eat properly.

Confessing that he has suffered issues with his eating and sleeping patterns over the past nine weeks, Chris told the publication that he is waiting for blood test results to find the root of the problem and feels 'stressed'.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

He also said he's feeling "constantly tired" and keeps getting headaches .

Chris opened up at the Pride of Britain Awards; one of the hottest tickets on the showbiz calendar where celebrities gathered to celebrate the country's unsung heroes.

Chris looked typically dapper in a smart black tuxedo as he worked the red carpet while his dramatic weight loss could be easily seen.

When speaking to Mirror Online at the highly-anticipated event, Chris spoke proudly of his Little Mix girlfriend Jesy Nelson and praised her for her strength after suffering years of abuse from online trolls.

Little Mix are currently on their world tour; with Jesy having to miss Pride of Britain because they were performing in Sheffield.

(Image: Instagram)

Other celebrities at the awards included Love Islanders Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury, Amanda Holden , Simon Cowell , the cast of Strictly Come Dancing and This Morning presenters Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

Pride of Britain celebrates extraordinary people from across Britain who have shown incredible bravery and spirit.

Pride of Britain will be on ITV on Tuesday 5 November, from 8pm until 10pm.

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
description: The former Love Island star admitted that he lost his appetite nine weeks ago and has been forced to undergo blood tests to discover the root of the issue
